pullRequest.title: Replace JITSERVER_SUPPORT with J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER
pullRequest.bodyText:
Replace macro JITSERVER_SUPPORT with J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER so as to have
a single macro to enable the JITServer support both in VM and JIT.
Closes: #8229
Signed-off-by: Ashutosh Mehra mehra.ashutosh@ibm.com

commit.message:
Replace JITSERVER_SUPPORT with J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER

Replace macro JITSERVER_SUPPORT with J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER so as to have
a single macro to enable the JITServer support both in VM and JIT.

Closes: #8229

Signed-off-by: Ashutosh Mehra <mehra.ashutosh@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Don't we need these defines? Are the definitions added in some other place?
Isn't this now redundant given J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER is defined in runtime/CMakeLists.txt?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -80,10 +80,10 @@ add_custom_command(
 )
 add_custom_target(j9jit_tracegen DEPENDS ${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/env/ut_j9jit.h)
 
-# JITSERVER_SUPPORT and protobuf
-if(JITSERVER_SUPPORT)
+# J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER and protobuf
+if(J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER)
 	message(STATUS "JITServer is supported")
-	add_definitions(-DJITSERVER_SUPPORT)
+	add_definitions(-DJ9VM_OPT_JITSERVER)

nodes.bodyText: Can you please fix the inconsistent indentation while you're here.

commit.message:
Add J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER to j9cfg.h.in for cmake build system

Instead of adding -DJ9VM_OPT_JITSERVER, add it to j9cfg.h.in
so that cmake system can convert it to define or undef depending
on the env variable with same name.

Signed-off-by: Ashutosh Mehra <mehra.ashutosh@ibm.com>
